titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3246) to assist small businesses and labor organizations in defending themselves against government bureaucracy; to ensure that employees entitled to reinstatement get their jobs back quickly; to protect the right of employers to have a hearing to present their case in certain representation cases; and to prevent the use of the National Labor Relations Act for the purpose of disrupting or inflicting economic harm on employers.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-463, by Mr. Dreier.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3246. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. No amendment to shall be in order except the amendment printed in the report accompanying this resolution, to be offered in the order and manner specified in the report, and not subject to further amendment or a demand for division of the question in the House or in the Committee of the Whole.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 161.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 185 (Roll No. 76).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/25/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3246 (small business and labor rights).
